body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of the City of Louisville, State of Kentucky would most respectfully unite with Moses & Fanny Block, in their petition to your Excellency to remit their fined imposed July 46th 1863; and would further state that the exercise of executive clemency towards them would be, as we believe proper and right.

L. Bamberger
Wm Kniephaber
M. Bach
Sam'l Lieberman
S. G. Henry & Co
T Anderson & Co
James S. Phelps
Wm Mix
L. Kahn
S. Ullman
H. Keisker
B. Hess
M H Richardson
Alex. owens

I have known Mr. M. Block for Eleven years, and during all that time he has born the reputation of a peace-loving, charitable gentleman. For a number of years he held offices of trust and honor in my Congregation, and has discharged them to his credit. Being , as I confidently believe, his first error, I add willilngly my name to aid the petitioners.

B. H. Gotthelf
Minister of the Jew. Congreg.

Hughes & Parkhill
N R Levin & C
J P Buckner,
Prather, &, Smith
Nathan Bloom
Wm Skene
Edwd Fuller
John Christopher
F. H. Hegan
Barkhouse & Co
L , C, Hopkins
Hart & Co
J. van Borries & Co
Jno Colemann
The fine of Fifty dollars agst Fanny Block is remitted-- One half of the fine against her husband is remitted
